hanzi-su-wiki:
球

Значения

Шар, мяч, бусинка

Мнемоника

Драгоценному камню 王 требуется 求 иметь округлость шара.

Варианты

毬
purpleculture_pinyin:
qiú
ball; sphere; globe; Classifiers: 个
мяч; сфера; глобус; Классификаторы: 个
rtega_mnemonic:
球球RS
X		ball, sphere, globe
  • what the king 王 requests 求 as presents; he needs many jewel-like objects to pay his soldiers
 丸 玉

球球RS毬ball, sphere, globe, round
  • the globe revolves around what the king 王 (hand 手) requests 求; the kings 王 sphere of influence is determined by who he can ask to 求
 丸 玉
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 求 indicates the sound; 王 (jade) conveys the meaning.

球队 [ qiú duì ]: sports team (basketball, soccer, football etc)

heisig_chinese_memo: The king requests that you be at the royal ball!
heisig_constituent: ball, king, jewel, ball, request, arrow, grains of rice
koohiiStory1: Someone files a request to see the family jewels and, to their surprise, you show them your balls!
koohiiStory2: The KING REQUESTS your presence at the ball ... game.
jp_example_words:
眼球(がんきゅう): eyeball
球根(きゅうこん): (plant) bulb
球(きゅう): globe, sphere, ball
球(たま): globe, sphere, ball
地球(ちきゅう): the earth
電球(でんきゅう): light bulb
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The king requests a sphere! He didn't say what kind though, so you're going to have to figure it out and bring him the right kind of sphere.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine all the different spheres you know and bring them to the king one by one. He doesn't seem to like any of them... think of more spheres!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You can't seem to find the sphere the king requested, so you take a break, sit down, and take out your lunch. "THAT!" the king screams, "THAT IS THE SPHERE I REQUESTED!" You look down and he's pointing to the cut up cucumbers (きゅう) in your salad.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Cucumbers aren't really spheres... they're circles at best if you cut them, but you can't tell the king that. Just let him eat your cucumbers and think they're sphere-shaped. Maybe next time use a melon-baller and make your cucumbers into spheres for him.
Ru_trainchinese: qiú: (сущ) шарик, шаровидный предмет; мяч; игра в мяч; шар, сфера
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the king (王) requests (求) a ball
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The king requests that you be at the royal ball!
humanum_full_description_en:
From " Jade " to the sound of " begging ", the original meaning is beautiful jade. "Said Wen": "Yu Sheng Ye. From jade, beg for sound. Zhuan, ball or Cong Yu." Duan Yucai's note: "Yu Ye. Xuan Ben: Yu is full. No. Er Ya‧ Shi Qi" says : Zhuan, beautiful jade. "Yugong", "Ritual Vessel" Zheng Zhutong. "Song": small ball big ball. "Biography" said: ball, jade also. Press the bell to take the ball as it, hence the name ball, The original teaching of non-ball is jade chime.” Duan Yucai saw that "Shuowen" is different from the present one, so there is a difference between "yu chime" and "yusheng" (click: "yusheng" may be wrong.) Shu‧Gu Ming": "Dayu, Yiyu, Celestial Ball, River Map, in the Eastern Preface."

" Ball " can refer to jade chime. "Shu‧Yiji": "Hit the ball, beat the piano, and chant, ancestor test." Kong Chuan: "Ball, jade chime."

" Ball " is the same as "毬", which means Ju, which is an ancient game equipment. " Ball " in modern Chinese means round-shaped sporting goods (such as "basketball", "football", and "ping pong").

" Ball " in modern Chinese can also mean a solid that takes the diameter of a semicircle as the axis and rotates the semicircle once, such as: "sphere", "spherical surface", "sphere center"; meanwhile, it can refer to spherical or nearly spherical Objects, such as "eyeballs" and "balloons". This kind of semantics is related to the meaning of "round body" in " ball " which means "spherical sports goods".
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " jade " and " begging ", the original meaning is beautiful jade.
humanum_full_description:
從「玉」，「求」聲，本義為美玉。《說文》：「玉聲也。从玉，求聲。璆，球或从翏。」段玉裁注：「玉也。鉉本：玉罄也。非。《爾雅‧釋器》曰：璆，美玉也。《禹貢》、《禮器》鄭注同。《商頌》：小球大球。《傳》曰：球，玉也。按磬以球爲之，故名球，非球之本訓爲玉磬。」段玉裁所見《說文》與今本有異，故有「玉磬」、「玉聲」之別（按：「玉聲」恐有誤。）《書‧顧命》：「大玉、夷玉、天球、河圖，在東序。」

　　「球」可指玉磬。《書‧益稷》：「戛擊鳴球，搏拊琴瑟，以詠，祖考來格。」孔傳：「球，玉磬。」

　　「球」同「毬」，表示鞠，即古代的一種游戲用具。現代漢語「球」表示圓球形的體育用品（如「籃球」、「足球」、「乒乓球」）即從此義引申而成。

　　「球」在現代漢語中還可表示以半圓的直徑為軸，使半圓旋轉一周而成立的立體，如：「球體」、「球面」、「球心」；同時可泛指球形或接近球形的物體，如「眼球」、「氣球」。此類語義與「球」表示「圓球形的體育用品」中的「圓形體」意義相關。

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 求 indicates the sound; 王 (jade) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 王 [ wáng ] king, ruler; royal; surname
    • 求 [ qiú ] to seek; to request, to demand; to beseech, to beg for
①圆形的立体物：圆球。球茎。球体。气球。煤球。
②指球形的体育用品，球类运动：球艺。球员。球坛。球迷。
③星体，特指“地球”：月球。星球。誉满全球。
④美玉。
球员 [ qiú yuán ]: sports club member; footballer, golfer etc
球队 [ qiú duì ]: sports team (basketball, soccer, football etc)

從「 玉 」，「 求 」聲，本義為美玉。《說文》：「玉聲也。从玉，求聲。璆，球或从翏。」段玉裁注：「玉也。鉉本：玉罄也。非。《爾雅‧釋器》曰：璆，美玉也。《禹貢》、《禮器》鄭注同。《商頌》：小球大球。《傳》曰：球，玉也。按磬以球爲之，故名球，非球之本訓爲玉磬。」段玉裁所見《說文》與今本有異，故有「玉磬」、「玉聲」之別（按：「玉聲」恐有誤。）《書‧顧命》：「大玉、夷玉、天球、河圖，在東序。」 「 球 」可指玉磬。《書‧益稷》：「戛擊鳴球，搏拊琴瑟，以詠，祖考來格。」孔傳：「球，玉磬。」 「 球 」同「 毬 」，表示鞠，即古代的一種游戲用具。現代漢語「 球 」表示圓球形的體育用品（如「籃球」、「足球」、「乒乓球」）即從此義引申而成。 「 球 」在現代漢語中還可表示以半圓的直徑為軸，使半圓旋轉一周而成立的立體，如：「球體」、「球面」、「球心」；同時可泛指球形或接近球形的物體，如「眼球」、「氣球」。此類語義與「 球 」表示「圓球形的體育用品」中的「圓形體」意義相關。
From " Jade" to the sound of " begging", the original meaning is beautiful jade. "Said Wen": "Yu Sheng Ye. From jade, beg for sound. Zhuan, ball or Cong Yu." Duan Yucai's note: "Yu Ye. Xuan Ben: Yu is full. No. Er Ya‧ Shi Qi" says : Zhuan, beautiful jade. "Yugong", "Ritual Vessel" Zheng Zhutong. "Song": small ball big ball. "Biography" said: ball, jade also. Press the bell to take the ball as it, hence the name ball, The original teaching of non-ball is jade chime.” Duan Yucai saw that "Shuowen" is different from the present one, so there is a difference between "yu chime" and "yusheng" (click: "yusheng" may be wrong.) Shu‧Gu Ming": "Dayu, Yiyu, Celestial Ball, River Map, in the Eastern Preface." " Ball" can refer to jade chime. "Shu‧Yiji": "Hit the ball, beat the piano, and chant, ancestor test." Kong Chuan: "Ball, jade chime." " Ball" is the same as " 毬", which means Ju, which is an ancient game equipment. " Ball" in modern Chinese means round-shaped sporting goods (such as "basketball", "football", and "ping pong"). " Ball" in modern Chinese can also mean a solid that takes the diameter of a semicircle as the axis and rotates the semicircle once, such as: "sphere", "spherical surface", "sphere center"; meanwhile, it can refer to spherical or nearly spherical Objects, such as "eyeballs" and "balloons". This kind of semantics is related to the meaning of "round body" in " ball" which means "spherical sports goods".

球字的基本解释

球
qiú
圆形的立体物：圆球。球茎。球体。气球。煤球。
指球形的体育用品，球类运动：球艺。球员。球坛。球迷。
星体，特指“地球”：月球。星球。誉满全球。
美玉。

球字的汉语字典释义
球字的康熙字典解释
球字的源字形
球字的起名意思

：一般指圆形的立体物，如球琳器，比喻贤才；本义指美玉，如球璧，泛指珍宝，宝贝。

ball
Basic explanation of words
ball
qiú
Round three-dimensional objects: round balls. bulb. Sphere. balloon. Briquettes.
Refers to spherical sporting goods, ball sports: ball art. Players. Football. fan.
The star, especially the "earth": the moon. Planet. Renowned all over the world.
Beautiful jade.
ball
Chinese dictionary definition of words
ball
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
ball
Source glyph
ball
Name meaning
: Generally refers to a round three-dimensional object, such as a ball-lin ware, which is a metaphor for a talented person; the original meaning refers to a beautiful jade, such as a ball-bi, generally refers to treasures and treasures.
qiú
сущ.
1) шар; сфера; шаровой, сфероидальный, глобулярный
天球 небесная сфера
地球 земной шар
全球 весь земной шар, весь мир
南半球 южное полушарие
球带 мат. шаровой пояс
球圆锥 сферический конус
2) шарик, шаровидное тело; дискообразный (шарообразный) предмет; биол. луковица
眼球 глазное яблоко
红血球 красное кровяное тельце
山慈菇球 луковица тюльпана
毛球 луковица волоса
3) надувной шар; мяч, мячик
气球 воздушный шар, аэростат
皮球 кожаный мяч
足球用球 футбольный мяч
4) игра в шар (мяч) (в названиях различных игр обычно типовая морфема; в отсутствие уточнения, как правило, означает футбол); игра с мячом, игра в мяч
足球 футбол
网球 теннис
篮球 баскетбол
台球 бильярд
球进了！ Гол! (возглас комментатора)
球赛 соревнование по игре в мяч
球迷 болельщик
5) * нефритовый клейнод, скипетр из яшмы
小球大球 малый клейнод и большой клейнод (регалии, знаки княжеского достоинства в малых и больших владениях)
6) * муз. нефритовое било, ударная пластинка из яшмы
戛击鸣球 легко ударить в звонкие нефритовые била
Radicals: 王, 求  (king, request)
Meaning Mnemonic
The king requests a sphere! He didn't say what kind though, so you're going to have to figure it out and bring him the right kind of sphere.
Imagine all the different spheres you know and bring them to the king one by one. He doesn't seem to like any of them... think of more spheres!
Reading Mnemonic
You can't seem to find the sphere the king requested, so you take a break, sit down, and take out your lunch. "THAT!" the king screams, "THAT IS THE SPHERE I REQUESTED!" You look down and he's pointing to the cut up cucumbers (きゅう) in your salad.
Cucumbers aren't really spheres... they're circles at best if you cut them, but you can't tell the king that. Just let him eat your cucumbers and think they're sphere-shaped. Maybe next time use a melon-baller and make your cucumbers into spheres for him.

Examples: 球 (たま)
丶 (капля), 水 (вода), 王 (монарх)
